item.title: Version 1.9.21
item.description:
NameQuick v1.9.21 Release Notes

Bug Fixes

Template Transformation Rules

  • Fixed: Only first transformation rule was being applied - When you added multiple transformation rules to a template (like “Convert to lowercase” and “Replace spaces with dashes”), only the first rule would work. Now all rules are applied in the order you specified.
  • Fixed: Template save button not responding - The save button would sometimes become unresponsive when editing templates with transformation rules. This has been resolved with improved state management.
  • Fixed: UI refresh issues when editing transformation rules - The template editor now properly updates when adding or modifying post-processing rules, ensuring a smooth editing experience.

File Renaming Issues

  • Fixed: Files wouldn’t rename when only changing letter case - Previously, renaming “Invoice.PDF” to “invoice.pdf” would fail silently. This has been fixed - case-only renames now work properly.
  • Fixed: Some renamed files weren’t actually changing on disk - In certain situations, NameQuick would show a file as renamed but the actual file wouldn’t change. This has been resolved.

AI Provider Improvements

  • Fixed: Template processing reliability - Resolved issues where templates would sometimes fail to generate the expected filename format, particularly with Gemini and OpenAI providers.
  • Improved: Gemini error messages - HTTP 400 errors from Gemini now provide specific, actionable guidance:
    • Schema validation errors suggest simplifying template fields
    • API key errors direct users to verify their credentials
    • Quota errors point to Google Cloud Console for usage details
    • File format errors suggest trying different files

Ollama Integration

  • New: Structured outputs support - Implemented Ollama’s structured outputs feature for improved reliability:
    • All models running Ollama v0.5+ now support JSON schema-based outputs
    • LLaVA models (including llava:7b) and moondream use structured outputs by default
    • Automatic fallback to enhanced JSON prompts for older models
  • Enhanced: Date extraction reliability - Improved date detection with comprehensive format examples:
    • Now recognizes ISO dates (2025-06-19), US/EU formats (06/19/2025, 19/06/2025)
    • Handles written dates (June 19, 2025), partial dates (June 2025)
    • Better detection of date indicators like “Invoice Date:”, “Due Date:”, etc.
    • Clear instructions to return empty strings instead of “null” or “N/A” when dates aren’t found
  • New: Model quality indicators - Added visual guidance for model selection:
    • Star icon (green) for recommended models with high extraction accuracy
    • Checkmark (blue) for models with good performance
    • Warning triangle (orange) for models that may have accuracy issues
    • Helps users choose appropriate models for their extraction needs
  • Fixed: Ollama timeout issues - Increased timeouts to prevent failures with slower models:
    • Request timeout increased from 60 seconds to 5 minutes
    • Processing timeout for Ollama increased to match
    • Prevents “The request timed out” errors when using models like moonshot

Technical Improvements

  • Refined animation handling in transformation editor for better performance
  • Enhanced state synchronization between view models and UI components
  • More robust error parsing and user-friendly error messages
  • Implemented Ollama’s GBNF grammar-based structured outputs for all compatible models

Thank you for your patience as we improve NameQuick! If you encounter any issues, please report them at support@namequick.cc
